content.rendered:
German RepRap L280 LAM 3D Printer

The L280 3D printer by German RepRap, is a real Game Changer. For the first time, it is possible to use liquid material such as Liquid Silicone Rubber (LSR) for additive manufacturing.

contact us

Phone

03 9687 8638

Address

7A Kent St,
Yarraville, VIC 3013
Australia.

Send a Message

    Are you uploading files larger than 5mb?
    Upload Large File

    Do you want a quote based on your STL?
    Instant Quote Calculator


    (Accepted filetypes: pdf,jpg,jpeg,png & gif. Max file size: 5mb)

    Print Liquid Silicone Rubber (LSR)

    Liquid Silicone Rubber (LSR) is a biocompatible, durable, chemical resistant material that can withstand extreme temperatures. This makes it ideal for applications including medical, automotive, industrial and consumer products.

    More complex geometries with LSR are now achievable

    The L280 allows you to produce LSR structures too complex for molds, while also producing inner structures previously not possible.

    New Print Head Technology

    The new print head technology allows precise metering and mixing ratios. A special blender head ensures optimal connection of both supplied components. The mixing ratio is thus precisely adjustable and allows intervention at the layer level. Where conventional production technologies such as injection molding require all molecules to be aligned, the LAM technology can be used to influence the application direction and, thus, the cross-linking at a molecular level, resulting in better material strength compared to injection molding.

    Thermal Cross-linking

    The special halogen lamp accelerates the cross-linking, on a molecular level, between the two components, reducing how long it takes for the silicon to set between layers producing parts faster.

    Integrated Safety System Monitors

    An integrated safety system monitors printing and curing processes, any deviations will automatically stop the print job.

    Precision in Continuous Operation

    Produced in Germany with high-quality components. The L280 is a long-lasting device that has been designed from the outset for commercial use.

    Stand-Alone Printing

    The touchscreen allows intuitive operation of the printer via USB for stand-alone printing. Alternatively you can send prints via a network connection.

    Simplify3D Software

    One integrated software suite contains everything you need to print high quality parts. Customizable settings and advanced processes put the controls in your hands.

    On Site Service

    We offer on-site service by trained technicians. In addition to maintenance and repair services, we also offer software and hardware training.

    Specifications

    Model L280
    Build platform* (XxYxZ) 280 x 280 x 200 mm
    Print speed 10 – 150 mm/s
    Travel speed 10 – 300 mm/s
    Position accuracy* (X/Y) +/- 0,1 mm/s
    Layer height (min.) 0,22 – 0,9 mm
    Material EVOLV3D™ LC 3335 Liquid Silicone Rubber (LSR)
    Nozzle options 0,23 | 0,4 | 0,8 mm
    Print bed temperature 110°C
    Options Maintenance contract, material pails
    File transfer USB, Stand-alone printing with touch display, Ethernet
    Software Simplify3D Software
    Operating voltage 230 VAC
    Ambient temperature 15-26°C
    Outer dimensions (WxDxH) Printer with cartridge system: 700 x 700 x 2040 mm
    Printer with material pails: 700 x 700 x 2260 mm
    Weight 120 kg (without material removal system)
    Technology LAM (Liquid Additive Manufacturing)

    * depending on setting/process
